police_act.description: The Police Act, 1861 regulates the police force in India, detailing their powers, duties, and responsibilities. This document is useful for answering questions about the legal framework governing police operations.

standing_order.description: The Police Standing Orders provide detailed guidelines on procedures and protocols for police officers. Use this document when questions concern police procedures or operational guidelines.

ipc_codes.description: The Indian Penal Code (IPC) is the main criminal code of India, covering all substantive aspects of criminal law. It includes definitions and punishments for crimes such as theft.

emergency_numbers.description: This document lists emergency contact numbers, including those for police, fire, and medical services.

fir.description: A First Information Report (FIR) details the initial steps in criminal investigations. It is useful for questions on procedural aspects of law enforcement when a crime is reported.
